subclusters.subcluster_name: Ink4/Arf and p53 Regulation Theory of Aging
Stress-Induced Premature Senescence via p38 MAPK Theory
Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on tumor suppressor pathways p16INK4a and p53 regulating senescence growth arrest and SASP driving aging and age-related diseases.
Emphasizes p16INK4a as a marker and mediator of senescence causing tissue deterioration, linking injury and aging via common pathways.
Describes senescent cells accumulating in metabolic tissues with SASP causing insulin resistance and diabetes, regulated by p16INK4a/p53 pathways.
Details senescence induction by telomere attrition and stress with p53/p16 pathways enforcing arrest and SASP promoting inflammation and aging.
Focuses on senescent cell accumulation in lung aging with SASP-driven inflammation and impaired clearance, involving p53/p16 pathways.
Highlights senescence in multiple tissues including CNS with SASP causing neurodegeneration, regulated by p53/p16 tumor suppressor pathways.
Describes senescent cells in kidney causing fibrosis and dysfunction via SASP and prosurvival pathways, regulated by p53/p16 mechanisms.
Identifies senescence biomarkers linked to cell cycle arrest and SASP driving systemic aging, consistent with p16INK4a/p53-mediated senescence.
Integrates replicative and stress-induced senescence with telomere dysfunction activating p53/p16 pathways and SASP causing aging.
Shows senescent cells cause vascular aging via SASP and mitochondrial ROS, with p53/p16 pathways mediating senescence and inflammation.
Focuses on NF-κB transcription factor regulating senescence and SASP downstream of p53/p16 pathways enforcing growth arrest.
Details SASP heterogeneity and its role in aging biomarkers, consistent with p53/p16-driven senescence secretory phenotype.
Compares oncogene-induced and replicative senescence, both regulated by p53 and pRB pathways enforcing arrest and SASP.
Describes senescent cell cycle arrest, SASP, apoptosis resistance, and tissue dysfunction consistent with p16INK4a/p53 senescence mechanisms.
Discusses systemic and local senolysis effects on senescent cells with SASP, consistent with p53/p16-mediated senescence and aging.
Links senescence, SASP, inflammation, and cancer via NF-κB and p53/p16 pathways maintaining the proinflammatory secretory phenotype.
Shows senescent cells expressing p16Ink4a/p21Cip1 cause bone aging and osteoporosis via SASP, independent of estrogen deficiency.
Describes adipose tissue senescence with SASP causing metabolic dysfunction and insulin resistance, regulated by p16INK4a/p53 pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Ink4/Arf and p53 Regulation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses specifically on Ink4/Arf locus and p53 activity regulating neural stem cell maintenance and delaying CNS aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Ink4/Arf and p53 Regulation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mutant p53 mice with enhanced p53 activity showing early aging phenotypes, highlighting p53's role in organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Ink4/Arf and p53 Regulation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows p53/CEP-1 regulates energy metabolism and mitochondrial function affecting lifespan, linking p53 to metabolic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence via p38 MAPK Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p38 MAP kinase activation by stress causing premature senescence independent of telomere shortening, with p53/p21 involvement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence via p38 MAPK Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details p38 MAPK activation driving premature senescence in Werner syndrome fibroblasts, reversible by p38 inhibition.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence via p38 MAPK Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Progeroid syndromes caused by DNA helicase defects and nuclear lamina abnormalities causing premature senescence linked to stress pathways including p38.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy causing accumulation of damaged components, contributing to cellular senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: FOSL2 transcription factor drives inflammatory SASP gene expression in aging liver progenitor cells, linking inflammation and senescence.
